Revenue.description: Revenue from contracts with customers – principles for recognition, measurement, and disclosure.
key_points: Identify the contract with a customer
Recognize revenue when obligations are satisfied

Leases.description: Accounting for leases by lessees and lessors, introducing the right-of-use model.
key_points: Recognize right-of-use asset and lease liability
Measure lease liability at present value of payments

Financial Instruments.description: Classification, measurement, impairment, and hedge accounting for financial instruments.

Assets.description: Guidance on tangible and intangible assets, and impairment testing.
key_points: Property, plant and equipment recognition and depreciation
Intangible assets recognition (internally generated vs acquired)
Impairment testing – recoverable amount vs carrying amount

Liabilities.description: Accounting for provisions, contingent liabilities, and financial liabilities.
key_points: Recognize provisions when obligation is probable and measurable

Equity.description: Presentation and disclosure of equity, share capital, reserves, and distributions.
key_points: Classification of instruments between equity and liability
